premises: If an object is in motion, it has kinetic energy
The object does not have kinetic energy
conclusions: The object is not in motion
incorrect conclusions: The object is in motion and it has kinetic energy
If the object has kinetic energy, then it is in motion
If the object does not have kinetic energy, then it is in motion
If the object is not in motion, then it does not have kinetic energy

premises: If a metal rod is heated, it expands
The metal rod does not expand
conclusions: The metal rod is not heated
incorrect conclusions: The metal rod is heated and it expands
If the metal rod expands, then it is heated
If the metal rod does not expand, then it is heated
If the metal rod is not heated, then it does not expand

premises: If a substance is an acid, it turns blue litmus paper red
The substance does not turn blue litmus paper red
conclusions: The substance is not an acid
incorrect conclusions: The substance is an acid and it turns blue litmus paper red
If the substance turns blue litmus paper red, then it is an acid
If the substance does not turn blue litmus paper red, then it is an acid
If the substance is not an acid, then it does not turn blue litmus paper red
